Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 29th overall pick, by Atlanta in 1969...
Injured on 8/13/1970 with a Concussion, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 7/23/1972, off Gene Brabender (HOU)...
Hit first career homerun on 8/11/1972, off Sandy Koufax (PHI)...
Injured on 7/20/1977 with a Tight Knee, out for one week...
Had 27-game hitting streak snapped on 8/28/1977...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Pittsburgh on 6/28/1978...
Was selected to the 1978 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Cincinnati on 7/14/1979...
Drove in 7 runs against New York (N) on 7/16/1979...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against St. Louis on 8/15/1979...
Traded from Atlanta to Los Angeles on 5/1/1980 (Going to ATL: 3B W. Boggs, CF R. Henderson, 2B M. Barrett, P R. St. Claire. Going to LA: P B. Dillman, C B. Downing)...
Had 21-game hitting streak snapped on 5/1/1980...
Was selected to the 1980 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/21/1980, hitting .522 with 0 HR, 7 RBI...
Won MVP Award in 1980, hitting .356 with 12 HR, 102 RBI...
